reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used the hotel as a "base" to visit war gravesite of wife's great uncle for our first day of our 8 weeks in France. Our Privilege Room with 1 king-size bed room was ideal with a view of the Cathdral. Located close to the restaurants. The only downside was the lack on-site car parking. We needed to use a closeby car public car park. Make sure you take Euro cash or coin to pay for the parking. With my limited French I could not read the instructions to use credit card or cash card. The drop off and pick up car parking in front of the hotel is limited. Word of warning: Even though the car had a GPS we fortunately used our faithful Tom Tom (with downloaded Europe map) to guide us around. Highly recommended for non or limited French speaking Australians! Also the challenge of French toll ("Péage"). They vary in cost and some are manned and others are cash or credit card. But expect delays and look for the correct symbols for cash or card. We mis read one and it was for a pre paid tags only - had to back out of lane. But the French are very patient and understanding!!
reviews.title: Central location and about 30 minutes to WW1 sites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel and Amiens way exceeded our expectations when we stayed for a night on our way up to catch the ferry home. Amiens is a beautiful and interesting town, with a magnificent cathedral and pretty canals. The hotel is ideally located in the centre of town, right by the cathedral, restaurants, shops and canals, but quiet for a good night's rest. Our room was large and very comfortable and the staff were very helpful and friendly. We strolled a couple of hundred yards to an excellent restaurant for dinner, where we sat outside with a lovely view of the cathedral. We called at the Tourist Information Office next to the cathedral, who were very helpful in giving us a free English guide to the Somme battlefields - well worth having if you are interested in visiting these. We were able to park our car in the street outside the hotel and as it was Sunday there was no charge until midday Monday.
reviews.title: Ideal base in Amiens

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for one night on the way back to the UK, July 2013. We had a Privilege Room with view over the cathedral. We did not eat in the hotel, choosing to have a meal from one of the many excellent restaurants by the river. After dining out we did use the bar, and despite it being late were served by friendly staff, and charged to the room no problem. The room was clean and modern, even a bluetooth radio you can drop your iPhone into which worked well.
reviews.title: Good hotel friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing I can think of, was lack of decent tea making facilities, you have a machine you have to put cartridges into, and paper cups, which I did try but was not impressed! My wife wouldn't even risk a taste!
reviews.title: Great hotel in Amiens

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here over night. Lovely hotel and great location. Car park is near the hotel but you do have to pay for it. That said, very nice, clean hotel. Would go back if we needed a hotel and where in the area.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: Don't know how, but on many previous disappointing trips to this city we missed the old town and canals - not this time and what a difference.
reviews.title: I take it all back Amiens!

reviews.text: Firstly though, the Mercure. Location brilliant, service as always coolly efficient, room excellent and breakfast ridiculously over priced at 15 Euros a person - don't blame Mercure though, seems endemic through hotels in France at the minute. Simple answer is to walk to the brasserie opposite and get the same breakfast for a third of the cost. The underground car park which works in unison with the hotel was competitive (even if we did go over the 15 hour deal limit). In general though this was a good experience hence the rare five star rating.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in a lovely city

reviews.text: As to Amiens I really can't figure how we've missed Saint Leu so many times previously. It's an old town I heartily recommend. Have a look at Saint Leu on this site if you require more in depth information.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for one night. Room large, with a settee. Air conditioning welcome in the summer. A slightly odd arrangement with the bathroom separated from the bedroom only with swing doors, and the toilet separate in a small room off the entrance way.
reviews.title: Worth the stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights in a Cathedral view room with a large balcony. Room had separate bathroom & toilet. Bathroom contain both a bath & a walk in shower. Good comfortable bed & bedding. Lounge area had small sofa & 2 chairs & coffee table. Coffee machine & fridge were handy as was the small dining suite.
reviews.title: Well placed for WW1 tour base.

reviews.text: Breakfast was OK but it would be nice not to have the same fare each day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Mercure Amiens Cathedrale is a well located, modern facility which serves as a good base for exploring both Amiens and the WW1 battlefields. The rooms are modern, clean and equipped to typical 3 star business levels. It is only a short walk to the Cathedral and the centre of the city as well as all the restaurants along the quai next to the Somme River. Car parking is in a parking station 2 blocks away where you can purchase a 3-day pass for 21 Euro. My only criticism is that the service is a bit "patchy" and as an example, our room developed an air-conditioning leak which necessitated a change of rooms. There was no offer to assist with the move and whilst the new room had a cathedral view (and thus was considered an upgrade), it wasn't as well equipped and didn't have a sofa.
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.text: We only spent a single night here before doing a battlefield tour but enjoyed our stay. Our room was probably one of the more poorly located ones in the hotel but as we were only there the one night we weren't concerned. The hotel was well located (near the Cathedral) the beds were comfortable, the price was reasonable (not cheap but not too expensive) and the staff were honest if not particularly attentive at times.
reviews.title: good views of the cathedral
